data.title: Find site lies in rectangle when we have latitude and longitude of all corners in oracle
data.meta_description:
I am having a table name as T. Suppose 
I have latitude, longitude of all four corners of a rectangle. How can I find which site or records lies in rectangle?

Suppose we have below left, length of...
data.text:
You can't use SDO_UTIL.GETNUMVERTICES to do that, because that gives you the number of vertices in a single shape and nothing more.

You could, however, construct an SDO_GEOMETRY with your ordinates like so:

sdo_geometry( 2003 -- geometry type 2D polygon , NULL -- or the relevant SRID corresponding to your data , NULL , sdo_elem_info_array(1, 1003, 1) , sdo_ordinate_array(x, y, x, y, x, y, x, y, x, y) -- fill in ordinates here )
